variable.name: GENEVA_ID
variable.comment: GENEVA IDs were randomly assigned to all subjects included in the phenotype dataset. This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: CASE_STATUS
variable.comment: This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: SEX
variable.comment: This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: AGE
variable.description: Age level at diagnosis (for cases) or age at study entry (for controls)
variable.comment: This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: MORPHOLOGY
variable.comment: This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.
variable.value: Missing information or non-eligible tumor, classified as a non-case

variable.name: STAGE
variable.comment: Indicates the lung cancer staging, according to the "Revisions in the International System for Staging Lung Cancer" [Chest 1997 Jun; 111(6): 1710-7]. Postoperative staging This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: SMOKING_STATUS
variable.comment: Never smoker defined as subject smoked less than 100 cigarettes in his entire life.Former smoker defined as subject smoked at least 100 cigarettes in his entire life and stopped smoking cigarettes more than 6 months before study.Current smoker defined as subject smoked at least 100 cigarettes in his entire life and he is still currently smoking cigarettes. This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: PACK_YEARS
variable.comment: Cumulative quantity of Pack-Years, calculated as Pack/day*years, where 1 pack=20 cigarettes This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: FTND
variable.comment: Calculated as the sum of the coded scores of questions C1-C6 inclusive where C1 answers coded: 0=After 60 minutes, 1=31-60 minutes, 2=6-30 minutes, 3=within 5 minutes, 99=Unknown or missingC2 answers coded: 0=No, 1=Yes, 99=Unknown or missingC3 answers coded: 1=The first one in the morning, 0=Any other, 99=Unknown or missingC4 answers coded: 0=Less than 10, 1=11-20, 2=21-30, 3=More than 30, 99=Unknown or missingC5 answers coded: 0=No, 1=Yes, 99=Unknown or missingC6 answers coded: 0=No, 1=Yes, 99=Unknown or missing This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.

variable.name: FH_OF_LUNG_CANCER
variable.comment: Family history of lung cancer defined as having at least one 1st degree relative with lung cancer This study consists of two datasets, PLCO and Eagle, and you are currently looking at a variable from the Eagle dataset. To access the PLCO dataset, please select the PLCO study in the Associated Variables navigation box to the right.
variable.value: At least one 1st degree relative with lung cancer
